message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CV (Computer Vision) - The paper proposes an approach to training a convolutional neural network using information on the level of distortion of input data. This is a common problem in computer vision, and the paper uses the MNIST dataset as an example.
2. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper modifies the learning process of the neural network, which falls under the category of machine learning. The approach proposed in the paper aims to improve the performance of the network by taking into account the statistical dependence of the response on the input data distortion.
3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper proposes an approach to training a neural network, which is a subfield of artificial intelligence. The approach aims to improve the performance of the network by taking into account the statistical dependence of the response on the input data distortion.
4. cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) - The paper focuses on training a convolutional neural network, which falls under the category of neural computing. The approach proposed in the paper modifies the learning process of the network to improve its performance.
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper uses the MNIST dataset, which is a common dataset in multimedia research. The approach proposed in the paper aims to improve the performance of the network in recognizing distorted images, which is a common problem in multimedia applications.
